question.name: Technology - Adobe Acrobat Reader
question.questiontext: To view some of the reading material for this course in PDF format, I have installed the free Adobe Acrobat Reader.
question.generalfeedback: You will likely need to install the free Adobe Acrobat Reader in order to access course readings and documents.

question.name: Technology - Multimedia Presentations
question.questiontext: To view multimedia presentations for this course, I have installed the free Flash Player.
question.generalfeedback: You will likely need to install the free Flash Player in order to access the video and PowerPoint presentations in this course.

question.name: Policy - Time Commitment
question.questiontext: For successful completion of this 16-week course, how many hours per week can I expect to spend working through lesson materials, readings, assignments, and other instructional activities?
question.generalfeedback: You can expect to spend between 6-8 hours per week on various instructional activities in this 8-week course.

question.name: Moodle - Discussion
question.questiontext: I can view all discussion threads for my Moodle course by clicking on the Forums under the Activities heading of the Navigation bar.
question.generalfeedback: This statement is true. You can view all discussion threads for this Moodle course by clicking on the Forums under the Activities heading of the Navigation bar.

question.name: Moodle - Grades
question.questiontext: To access your grades in Moodle, which link should you click?

question.name: Moodle - Questions about Course Content
question.questiontext: Who do I contact if I have a question about course content?
question.generalfeedback: Please see the "Getting Help" page under the Course Help tab for more information on who to contact when you need help.

answer.answertext: I should post my question in the General Q & A discussion forum

question.name: Moodle - Questions about Grades
question.questiontext: Who do I contact if I have a question about my grades, or if I have a personal issue I need to report (e.g., illness or anticipated absence)?
question.generalfeedback: Please see the "Getting Help" page under the Course Help tab for more information on who to contact when you need help.

answer.answertext: I should post my question in the General Q & A discussion forum

question.name: Moodle - Problems with logging in
question.questiontext: Who do I contact if I have issues logging into the course?
question.generalfeedback: Please see the "Getting Help" page under the Course Help tab for more information on who to contact when you need help.

answer.answertext: I should post my question in the General Q & A discussion forum

question.name: Policy - Student Commitment
question.questiontext: With respect to the level of participation expected in this course, how frequently am I expected to login to the course?
question.generalfeedback: By registering for this online course, you commit to accessing the course website and checking e-mail at least four days per week. You also commit to self-motivated study, participation in online course activities, and timely submission of all assignments. See the Course Policies page for more information.

question.name: Moodle - Resources
question.questiontext: Who do I contact to obtain disability-related academic adjustments (such as extended testing time or text conversion) and/or auxiliary aids?
question.generalfeedback: Students should contact both the instructor and the Disability Resources and Educational Services (DRES) as soon as possible. See the Course Policies page for specific contact information.

question.name: Policy - Time Commitment
question.questiontext: For successful completion of this 4-week course, how many hours per week can I expect to spend working through lesson materials, readings, assignments, and other instructional activities?
question.generalfeedback: You can expect to spend between 24-32 hours per week on various instructional activities in this 4-week course.
